creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: square candle stand supported by four open work spandrels above a central adjusting post; two small openwork panels at base
text: Lampstands were frequently made in pairs, but rarely have both survived. The ends of the middle rail fit into long grooves along the inner faces of the outside posts, allowing the central post to be moved up and down to adjust the height of the stand. Large candles were the standard light source for lampshades and hanging lanterns during the Ming and early Ch'ing dynasties.
title: Lampstand (shengjianshi dengtai), one of a pair
